statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.description: John Holland scored 16 points and Boston University defeated Hartford 55-49 on Sunday night in the America East Conference semifinals.
article.headline: BU bounces Hartford in America East semifinals
article.linkText: BU bounces Hartford in America East semifinals
article.story: WEST HARTFORD, Conn. -- John Holland scored 16 points and Boston University defeated Hartford 55-49 on Sunday night in the America East Conference semifinals. The second-seeded Terriers (20-13) will take a 10-game winning streak into the conference championship Saturday against No. 5 seed Stony Brook. The Terriers will be playing in their 15th America East Conference title game. In a tight game that saw 13 lead changes, a 3-pointer by Matt Griffin with 5:09 remaining gave the Terriers the lead for good at 45-43. Holland made 9 of 10 free-throw attempts, including 5 of 6 in the final 1:07 to secure the win. The Terriers have won seven of their past eight games against Hartford. Patrick Hazel added 10 points for the Terriers, who made 20 of 22 free-throw attempts while Hartford was only 2 of 5. Genesis Macial and Morgan Sabia each scored 13 points for the Hawks (11-20).
